hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (e.g., major regulatory announcement, CPI print), a sharp, high-volume price move followed by a 4-hour period of compressed volatility (ATR(4h) < 0.5 * ATR(24h)) will lead to a continuation of the initial move's direction within the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news creates a new information equilibrium. A sharp move followed by low volatility suggests absorption of the news and consolidation before the next leg, as early profit-takers exit and new directional conviction builds. This is a timing edge on the resumption of the new trend.
entry_conditions: High-impact news event identified via news sentiment API (score > 0.7 or < -0.7)
Subsequent 4-hour period where 4h ATR < 50% of 24h ATR
Volume during compression period is > 80% of 24h average (confirms participation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move in direction of initial news reaction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the breakout from compression is more often a false breakout or reversal (>55% of instances), or if the success rate is not statistically significant (p-value > 0.1) across 50+ historical events.
